description: Defines the source of data within a dataset.

Root.description:
Root sources are the points of entry of external data into the system.

Root source includes information like:
- Where to fetch the data from - e.g. source URL, a protocol to use, cache control
- How to prepare the binary data - e.g. decompression, file filtering, format conversions
- How to interpret the data - e.g. data format, schema to apply, error handling
- How to combine data ingested in the past with the new data - e.g. append as log or diff as a snapshot of the current state.

fetch.description: Determines where data is sourced from.

prepare.description: Defines how raw data is prepared before reading.

read.description: Defines how data is read into structured format.

preprocess.description: Pre-processing query that shapes the data.

merge.description: Determines how newly-ingested data should be merged with existing history.

Derivative.description: Derivative sources produce data by transforming and combining one or multiple existing datasets.

inputs.description: Datasets that will be used as sources.

transform.description: Transformation that will be applied to produce new data.
